qualitative_analysis.quote: the so-called integrators or enablers who provide services to facilitate the delivery, adoption, and use of cloud computing...we see old players going out of business, and new players of various types emerging to power
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes ecosystem transformation with traditional partners displaced by new types of service providers.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business models and opportunity creation: How IT entrepreneurs create and develop business models under uncertainty
qualitative_analysis.quote: after the fourteen years, the original idea is still alive...And now it fits with current terminology such as 'cloud gaming'...when we started there were no terms such as 'cloud,' we talked about server solutions
qualitative_analysis.justification: Illustrates technology terminology evolution and long-term business model development under uncertainty.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Revenue models, in-app purchase, and the app performance: Evidence from Apple's App Store and Google Play
qualitative_analysis.quote: the app market has shown an astonishing growth stepping from less than $10 billion annual revenue in 2011 up to estimated $70 billion by 2017
qualitative_analysis.justification: Quantifies dramatic app market growth from $10B to $70B demonstrating explosive expansion trajectory.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Revenue models, in-app purchase, and the app performance: Evidence from Apple's App Store and Google Play
qualitative_analysis.quote: industry statistics strongly report that paid apps generate higher revenue than free apps and are predicted to play a more prominent role also in the future
qualitative_analysis.justification: Predicts increasing importance of paid models alongside free apps in mobile market evolution.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Commercialization of Composite Software Resulting from Collaborative Research
qualitative_analysis.quote: ICT FP projects are increasingly dedicated towards innovation and commercialization of results of collaborative research
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes increasing focus on commercializing collaborative research outputs as business model trend.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Adjusting software revenue and pricing strategies in the era of cloud computing
qualitative_analysis.quote: all the case firms with a license model announced that they were moving increasingly toward servitization of their offering, and a software-renting model
qualitative_analysis.justification: Documents widespread vendor transition from perpetual licensing to service-based rental models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Adjusting software revenue and pricing strategies in the era of cloud computing
qualitative_analysis.quote: in the future there may well be an increase in new entries when software firms servitize their traditional software offering – similar to the situation that occurred in e-commerce during the IT boom
qualitative_analysis.justification: Predicts new market entrants as servitization trend creates opportunities similar to e-commerce boom.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Designing business models for cloud platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: the PaaS market is still growing swiftly but is largely fragmented and might be consolidated in the future. Current PaaS offerings have reached different maturity levels, which offers opportunities to study the dynamics and evolution of PaaS business models
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes PaaS market as rapidly growing but fragmented with expected future consolidation.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Designing business models for cloud platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: the software industry increasingly evolves into a platform business
qualitative_analysis.justification: States platform business model becoming standard approach in software industry evolution.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Business Models for Cloud Computing: Experiences from Developing Modeling & Simulation as a Service Applications in Industry
qualitative_analysis.quote: These business models are not an exhaustive list and new business models are being considered. Further business models and the evolution of those presented in this paper will be reported in future work
qualitative_analysis.justification: Acknowledges ongoing evolution and emergence of new cloud-based business models for M&S applications.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Study on a Decentralized SaaS Business Model
qualitative_analysis.quote: To improve the server revenue (and also the satisfaction rate), a fast learning method or a method that can recognize the periodic pattern should be adopted, which are left for the future work
qualitative_analysis.justification: Identifies predictive analytics and pattern recognition as future enhancements for SaaS revenue optimization.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Selection of the Proper Revenue and Pricing Model for SaaS
qualitative_analysis.quote: Recently, a number of studies have suggested that software renting is becoming more frequent in the new era of computing, in which software is delivered via the SaaS model
qualitative_analysis.justification: Documents software renting/subscription becoming increasingly frequent in SaaS era.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Service-Centric Business Model in Cloud Environment
qualitative_analysis.quote: The CBM accelerates the appearance of the new networked business ecosystem and forces enterprises to redesign their existing business logics to improve their running businesses
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes cloud business models driving ecosystem transformation and requiring business logic redesign.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Service-Centric Business Model in Cloud Environment
qualitative_analysis.quote: The firm's product-centric BM is transforming into a service-centric, value-oriented, and customer-based BM along with the BM evolution in trends of the cloud and servitization application
qualitative_analysis.justification: Characterizes fundamental transformation from product to service-centric business models driven by cloud.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Designing Viable Multi-sided Data Platforms: The Case of Context-Aware Mobile Travel Applications
qualitative_analysis.quote: Our next step will be studying the app developers' perspective. Earlier workshop and informal interviews with app developers suggest they may be willing to pay for data platforms if they truly add value for their business
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes emerging willingness-to-pay for data platforms as they demonstrate business value.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Economic and business perspectives on smartphones as multi-sided platforms
qualitative_analysis.quote: Mobile advertising revenues reached $3.18 billion in the U.S. in 2012 ($9.76 billion worldwide) and were forecast to reach $3.8 billion in the U.S. ($11.4 billion worldwide) in 2013
qualitative_analysis.justification: Quantifies mobile advertising growth as key revenue stream for smartphone platform business models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Crushing Candy: The Free-to-Play Game in Its Connective Commodity Form
qualitative_analysis.quote: Market researcher Newzoo projected that in 2015 the mobile segment's US$30.3 billion in global revenue will overtake the revenue generated via the sale of Triple-A console games
qualitative_analysis.justification: Predicts mobile gaming revenue surpassing console games, indicating major industry shift.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Effects of Freemium Strategy in the Mobile App Market: An Empirical Study of Google Play
qualitative_analysis.quote: Digi-Capital, an investment bank for mobile apps and games, has forecast that by 2017 mobile apps could reach a revenue of more than $70 billion globally, with nongame apps set to double revenue share from 26 percent to 51 percent
qualitative_analysis.justification: Projects substantial mobile app market growth with non-game apps increasing share significantly.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Network Externalities, Incumbent's Competitive Advantage and the Degree of Openness of Software Start-Ups
qualitative_analysis.quote: OS was born as an ideological movement, it has rapidly evolved into a business opportunity for software firms
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes open source evolution from ideological movement to mainstream business opportunity.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: A Pricing Framework for Software-as-a-Service
qualitative_analysis.quote: there are signs to suggest that this growth is likely to continue or even accelerate in the near future
qualitative_analysis.justification: Indicates expectation of continued or accelerating SaaS market growth in future.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Clarifying the Value Elements of Business Models for Disturbance Management in Supply Chains
qualitative_analysis.quote: Further research is needed in creating SaaS based business models for disturbance management. Especially, the quantitative estimations about cost structure and revenue streams are required
qualitative_analysis.justification: Identifies SaaS-based disturbance management as emerging application area requiring further development.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: The Impact of Open Source Software Commercialization on Firm Value
qualitative_analysis.quote: Vendors of proprietary software products are increasingly moving to business models inspired by open source software (OSS)
qualitative_analysis.justification: Documents proprietary vendors increasingly adopting OSS-inspired business models as growing trend.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: The relationship between Open Innovation and Strategy: data-driven analysis of the Mobile Value Services Industry
qualitative_analysis.quote: Convergence in the Fixed, Mobile and Media industries expanded the market's boundaries
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes industry convergence expanding market boundaries and creating cross-industry opportunities.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Open-Source Software Entrepreneurial Business Modelling
qualitative_analysis.quote: In particular, more thorough action research studies are on the way; guiding and observing focal startups in the use of this tool
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes ongoing development of frameworks to help startups develop open source business models.

qualitative_analysis.article_title: Towards a better Understanding of the Dynamics of Platform as a Service Business Models
qualitative_analysis.quote: Future research might include transforming this CLD into a quantitative model –a stock and flow diagram – where the insights gained so far could be further evaluated and manifested
qualitative_analysis.justification: Describes evolution toward more sophisticated quantitative modeling of PaaS business model dynamics.
